name: DoubleTree by Hilton Los Angeles Westside

reviews.title: Good but nothing special
reviews.text: The room (1 King bed) was surprisingly spacious. The furnishings were unremarkable, the usual hotel set-up.

reviews.title: Good Hotel, if a little tired
reviews.text: The Sleep Number bed was fun to play with and very comfortable in the end. We were on the 9th floor and didn’t hear any noise at night, neither from the hallway nor traffic outside.

reviews.title: Four stars. No complaints!
reviews.text: The bathroom was average hotel size, shower over a shallow tub. It was very clean and there were no moldy corners anywhere. I was disappointed at the water pressure, the shower was a pretty pathetic drizzle.

reviews.title: Good place
reviews.text: The little bathroom freebies were all there, including some aloe for all those beachgoers’ sunburns. Hairdryer and coffeemaker, too.

reviews.title: Good value, bring comfortable shoes
reviews.text: Breakfast is not included in the room rate, but you can go to the buffet in the lobby for approx. $15. There is also a small Starbucks stand in the lobby. Also a bar with several TVs turned to whatever sports is on that night.

reviews.title: Location was not ideal
reviews.text: This hotel was ok. We booked for 1 adult and 2 teenage children and got 2 double beds...not ideal, would have preferred 3 singles, 2 queen or 1 queen and a single. We only stayed for 2 nights and it was late when we arrived so did not bother to seek another room. We selected this hotel because it was close to the airport and free shuttle. It is quite isolated from anything. For example a taxi to Sony Studios was US$20 and to Santa Monica was US$40. In hind sight we would have been better staying at a hotel in Santa Monica with free airport - hotel shuttle. There was so much more to do at Santa Monica. We ordered room service on 2 occasions and would have been much better eating at the restaurant as the room service food was cold when it reached us. The hotel room was typical business hotel room , clean with very small bathroom.

reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised
reviews.text: What a great find. They were friendly, the rooms were nice, and they take pets( first floor only). There is a shuttle to LAX, and it is across from the wonderful Dinahs resturant ( great fried chicken).

reviews.title: Pleasant, Clean, Quiet
reviews.text: The only downside were the sheets and towels. I found both to be very rough.

reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Otherwise, a great stay.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: After reading several reviews of this hotel, I wasn't sure which hotel would greet us! From start to finish, our 2 night stay was of excellent quality. The staff was accomodating but not intrusive. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The Select Comfort beds were very nice, but took me a little bit of time to find my comfort zone. Room size was average, but for two guys here for a football game, it was more than adequate. The hotel was easy to find, and close enough to everything we wanted to do. Would stay here again without any hesitation. Oh, and the breakfast buffet and custom made omelett were a treat as well.

reviews.title: Great value as a conference hotel
reviews.text: I just stayed at the property for a conference for four days. This is a great conference hotel because the rooms were a spectacularly good value at 99.00 a night (would not have been such a good value at the regular hotel rate). They are a good size, the internet access is free (a real bonus), and nice and clean. The street noise is audible but not bad. The staff is really nice and goes out of their way to help. The room service food is a little pricey but not bad, and it comes promptly and it's hot.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, showing its age though
reviews.text: The one thing that was really annoying (and this happened to a lot of people at our conference) was that the room cards would regularly cease to work, necessitating endless trips to the desk for new cards that also would not work.

reviews.title: Very Comfortable Stay!!!!!
reviews.text: The Radisson in Culver City is a nice property with decent rooms. The beds and bedding were very nice. The furniture looks like it has been updated, however, the carpet and walls are showing their age. Carpet was beginning to tear/unravel in spots and the walls were dirty in some places. The bathroom had a new mirror and sink area. The overall feel of the hotel is good and was a good price at $115 a night, however, this was a discount rate we received because of the circumstances that took us out to LA. The price per night otherwise would have been about 165 and I'm not sure it's quite worth that amount. Parking is $19 a night which is typical of the LA area...you pay to park everywhere. I would think that parking should be included in the nightly rates. Also, the internet is very slow at this hotel.

reviews.title: Above average~No compliants here!
reviews.text: Stayed here for 12 nights recently and absolutely loved this hotel. Radisson just agrees with us, and this place was no exception. Room was spotlessly clean, and so was the bathroom. Housekeeping very competent. The room came with free Internet and an empty refrigerator, which is really commendable for a hotel of this class. You'd be amazed how much those two things will save you during a hotel stay. Also, free use of business center (including printers) and they give you complimentary water bottles. It's true that the parking here is expensive. But, all things considered, I do feel this is a generous hotel. I really hope it stays that way. We had a Sleep-Number bed, which was extremely comfortable. Bed linens and towels were crisp and clean. The grounds were very nice, with lush greenery and a pond surrounding the hallway that connects the elevators from the lobby. The pool area was nice, as well. The only negative was that our toilet was semi-obstructed from start to finish.

reviews.title: WORST HOTEL, will not stay there again.
reviews.text: By the way, we didn't hear freeway traffic at all from our room. We were in the middle part of the hotel, neither closest or farthest from the freeway. Also, anyone who complains that the view they got was that of freeway is not being fair. If you're on the south-facing side, you'll see the freeway, the Howard Hughes Center, the Westchester hill and rows of airplanes approaching LAX in the distance. If you'reon the north-facing side, you'll see the freeway and the parking lot, the garden/pool area, and then the view of the Westside all the way up to the Santa Monica Mountains, including Century City and Santa Monica in the distance. In other words, if you're high up enough to overlook the freeway, that means you'll have an interesting view to look at besides the freeway.

Booked six nights at $60 on Priceline. The property is right off Sepulveda and close to the 405. LAX and Fox Hills Mall are closeby as well. The room was very large, with a king-size bed with Sleep Number mattress. Furnishings are middle of the road but comfortable and modern. They have a pay parking lot ($19 per day according to their website), but there is plenty of free street parking in the industrial park across the street...save your money. I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice affordable option in West LA

reviews.text: Got a great rate on Hotwire. The hotel is clean and the staff was friendly and very helpful. We walked to the Promenade at Howard Hughes Center for dinner and then walked in the other direction to Albertson's for soda and munchies.
reviews.title: Liked the Culver City Radissson

likes.liked: — Hotwire price of $65 and free internet

reviews.text: Our room appeared to have brand new carpeting.
reviews.title: Perfecty decent

reviews.text: The only drawback was the daily parking fee. It was still a bargain with the Hotwire rate.
reviews.title: Room OK but very noisy (had to use earplugs to sleep!)

likes.disliked: — but far from anything else and very noisy

reviews.text: Don't be afraid to stay at the Radisson.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Not Great
